qas.question: What did Mary supposedly not require that everyone else also required and why was this so ?

answers.text: Another misunderstanding is that, by her immaculate conception, Mary did not need a saviour

qas.question: What was explained by the man  Giovanni Maria Mastai-Ferretti who later became leader of the Holy Roman Church ?

answers.text: dogma in Ineffabilis Deus, Pope Pius IX explicitly affirmed that Mary was redeemed in a manner more sublime

qas.question: What is the child of Mary known to be famous for according to  Giovanni Maria Mastai-Ferretti ?

answers.text: Jesus Christ, the Savior of the human race.

qas.question: According to the teaching of the Catholic religion is a savior for the world needed ?

answers.text: Catholic Church has taught that even had man never sinned in the Garden of Eden and was sinless, he would still require God's grace to remain sinless.

qas.question: Why did Mary not need a Savior?
Who said that Mary was cleansed after sin?

plausible_answers.text: Mary proclaims: "My spirit has rejoiced in God my Saviour."

qas.question: What is referred to as Mary's redemption by Christ?
Who said that if humans had never sinned they would not need God's grace?

context: <a0_0>Another misunderstanding is that, by <b4_0>her immaculate conception<b4_0/>, Mary did not need a saviour<a0_0/>. When defining the <a1_0>dogma in Ineffabilis Deus, <b5_0>Pope Pius IX<b5_0/> explicitly affirmed that Mary was redeemed in a manner more sublime<a1_0/>. He stated that Mary, rather than being cleansed after sin, was completely prevented from contracting Original Sin in view of the foreseen merits of <a2_0>Jesus Christ, the Savior of the human race.<a2_0/> In Luke 1:47, <b6_0>Mary proclaims: "My spirit has rejoiced in God my Saviour."<b6_0/> This is referred to as Mary's pre-redemption by Christ. Since the <b7_0>Second Council of Orange<b7_0/> against semi-pelagianism, the <a3_0>Catholic Church has taught that even had man never sinned in the Garden of Eden and was sinless, he would still require God's grace to remain sinless.
